channel.title: W3C Media Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Media Working Group

item.title: [picture-in-picture] Clarify/note Document.pictureInPictureElement is null for PiP launched from iframe
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/pictureInPictureElement

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

No response

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

Clarify Document.pictureInPictureElement is null for iframe with different origin than the parent document.

What did you expect to see?

Note or explanation that Document.pictureInPictureElement is null for iframe with different origin than the parent document.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

4.3. Extension to DocumentOrShadowRoot

partial interface mixin [DocumentOrShadowRoot](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#documentorshadowroot) {
  readonly attribute [Element](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#element)? pictureInPictureElement;
};

The pictureInPictureElement attributeâ€™s getter must run these steps:

If the context object is not [connected](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#connected), return null and abort these steps.

Let candidate be the result of [retargeting](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#retarget) Picture-in-Picture element against the context object.

If candidate and the context object are in the same [tree](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-tree), return candidate and abort these steps.

Return null.

Do you have anything more you want to share?

Steps to reproduce (where W3C Picture-in-Picture specification is supported):

  1. Append an iframe with src to an origin other than parent document's containing a media element that autoplays and is in auto picture in picture mode;
  2. When Picture-in-Picture loads call document.pictureInPictureElement; observe return value is null
